Posts.Content: May 21, 2007 03:39PM cmkfloralbiz wrote: I've not started radiation yet, just had surgery Friday (05/18). I waiting on more tests results and treatment plans. At first the plan was surgery, radiationd tamoxifen. However, that is not the case anymore. During the surgery more cancer was found than anticipated. I had the sentinal node biopsy done and not sure of that yet and my cancer hasn't been staged yet but found out that evidently I'm not a candidate for the tamoxifen because my cancer does not have the estrogen receptor sites? So from what I understand that means chemo. I have been given so much information in such a short amount of time I don't know anything anymore. Just when I think I have a good idea of what is going on then I find out I don't. Is that common or I am just freaking out?
Posts.Title: April '07 Camp Nukemboobies k4katz TrishE23
